doc.after: Kenya is divided into 47 semi autonomous counties that are headed by governors who were elected in the first general election under the new constitution in March 2013 These 47 counties now form the first order divisions of the country Under the old constitution Kenya comprised eight provinces each headed by a Provincial Commissioner centrally appointed by the president The provinces mkoa singular mikoa plural in Swahili were subdivided into districts wilaya
